titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Developing Countries Program, Vice President, Office Files of William D. Carmichael
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Developing Countries Program, Vice President, Office Files of William D. Carmichael FA711
titlestmt.author: Arranged and described by Jim Moske, Ford Foundation Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-11-20 02:17:28 -0500.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Developing Countries Program, Vice President, Office Files of William D. Carmichael
did.abstract: The Office Files of William D. Carmichael, Vice President of the Ford Foundation's Developing Country Programs (DCP) from 1981-1989, document his oversight of the program activities and administration of Foundation field offices around the world, and of New York-based program staff responsible for grants in developing countries. The collection spans 1968-1989 and consists of correspondence, memoranda, reports, grant proposals, conference materials and board of trustee meeting files. The files were transferred to and accessioned by the Ford Foundation Archives in 1990, and were fully processed in 2005.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: William D. Carmichael was Vice President of the Ford Foundation, Developing Country Programs, from 1981-1989. Prior to that he served the Foundation as Head of the Middle East and Africa Office (1977-1981), Head of the Office for Latin America and the Caribbean (1971-1977) and Representative in the Brazil Office (1968-1971). Key accomplishments of Carmichael's tenure as Vice President include his role in advancing the development of a Women's Program, financing for worldwide activities in community resource management, the expansion of Foundation activities throughout southern Africa. Carmichael and his staff played a leading role within the U.S. philanthropic and scholarly communities in the formulation of policies towards the apartheid regime in South Africa. After leaving the Ford Foundation he became executive director for Soviet Union and Eastern European Programs at the Institute of International Education. Carmichael holds an AB degree in Economics from Yale University, and a Ph.D. in Economics from Princeton University. He was Dean of the Cornell University Graduate School of Business and Public Administration from 1962-1968.

bioghist.head: Organizational History
bioghist.p: The administration of Ford Foundation international programs was dramatically restructured in 1980-1981, and a new office for Developing Country Programs was created. William D. Carmichael was appointed Vice President of this new area in March 1981. Carmichael oversaw the work of Foundation field offices, and of New York-based staff responsible for grants to developing countries until 1989.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Office Files of William D. Carmichael document Ford Foundation overseas grants during the period 1968-1989, with an emphasis on the 1980s. The bulk of the records concern Carmichael's work as Vice President, Developing Country Programs, and consist of correspondence, memos and reports pertaining to the administration and grant activities of FF field offices around the world. The collection also documents the relationship between overseas offices of the Ford Foundation and the headquarters in New York City. There are substantial records documenting Carmichael's travel and attendance at conferences, his participation in Board of Trustee meetings and his role in coordinating Board meetings convened overseas. Also included are budget planning records, program review documents, and subject files relating to numerous program initiatives and administrative matters of concern to Carmichael. The collection is particularly rich in material concerning the daily operations of field offices around the world, FF-funded educational programs in South Africa, and the international component of the Foundation's Women's Program.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Office Files of William D. Carmichael are arranged in six series:
I. Field Offices, 1972-1989 II. South Africa, 1974-1988 III. Conferences, Meetings and Trips, 1981-1988 IV. Program Budget, 1982-1989 V. Subjects, 1968-1989 VI. Board of Trustees, 1978-1989

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Material more than ten years old is open for scholarly research.
Select individual files are restricted, as noted. Permission to access these files must be obtained from the Ford Foundation before scholarly access is permitted.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Completion of a use agreement is required prior to providing scholarly access. See RAC Head of Reference (or applicable designee) for details.
Ford Foundation holds title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection for scholarly purposes. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files and officers papers were transferred to, and accessioned by, RAC beginning in 2011. Accessions continue as necessary.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: A list of unpublished reports written by FF staff and consultants were removed from the papers and transferred to the Archives' collection of staff and consultant reports. Appendix A lists the reports in alphabetical order by author. The number on the left is the assigned accession number and may be retrieved via the online catalog.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records more than 10 years old are open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, reports, press clippings and other records that document program development, grantmaking and grantee activities. Also included are records concerning the establishment, administration and daily operations of overseas offices. Numerous memos and reports written by Program Officers include vivid accounts of the political scene, current events and social and economic conditions in their host countries. Many reports contain general histories of regions or countries, as well as overviews of Foundation activities in these areas. Also included are files (restricted to Ford Foundation staff) concerning the opening of new offices in China and Zimbabwe, and on transferring the West Africa office from Lagos, Nigeria to Dakar, Senegal. The bulk of the series dates from the 1980s, though scattered memos and reports from the 1970s are also present.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged alphabetically by the region, with further sub-division by program officer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda and supporting documents concerning grantmaking and investment in South Africa by the Ford Foundation and other organizations. Includes files of Assistant Program Officer David Bonbright, and records of a committee of foundation and university executives convened by the Carnegie Corporation to promote better educational opportunities for black South Africans.

did.unittitle: Consortium on Educational Opportunities for Black South Africans
Fund for Education in South Africa

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, notes, agendas, reports, program submissions and briefing materials relating to William Carmichael's travel abroad on Foundation business, and his attendance at conferences and meetings worldwide. Events documented in these files include Ford Foundation staff meetings, field office site visits and conferences sponsored by other organizations. Of particular importance are extensive files on the 1985 United Nations Nairobi Conference marking the end of the Women's Decade, the 1983 meetings of the Ford Foundation International Affairs and Human Rights and Social Justice programs in Geneva, Switzerland, and a 1982 New York meeting of Indian Prime Minister Indira Gandhi with representatives of American philanthropies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Program budget submissions and related documentation from DCP and a few other Foundation divisions. Many files include substantive reports on the political, social, and economic climates of various countries in which the Foundation had offices. The Program Review files contained in Series V are closely related to these budget materials.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are arranged alphabetically by subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series contains records concerning miscellaneous program initiatives, administrative matters, outside organizations and topics of general interest to Carmichael. Included are DCP program review files, memos and reports concerning the origins of the Women's Program and the Health, Nutrition and Population Program, and correspondence concerning the Bilateral Commission on United States-Mexican Relations (access to the latter is restricted to Ford Foundation staff).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Select files are restricted from scholarly access as noted.

Rural Poverty and Resources Program Staff Meeting in Cairo

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, agendas, reports, briefing books and travel information, relating primarily to overseas meetings coordinated by William Carmichael and his staff. Included in some files are Carmichael's handwritten notes on meeting proceedings, and outlines for several of his presentations to the Board. Also a few files of correspondence with, and travel reports by, individual board members. Meeting minutes, dockets, reports and committee files previously and separately collected by the Archives are not included here. Access restricted to Ford Foundation staff.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: All contents of Series VI are restricted from scholarly access.
